intro: Pharus parvifolius subsp. elongatus, commonly known as the slender-leaved pharus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is known for its aromatic foliage. The subspecies is distinguished by its longer leaves compared to the typical form of Pharus parvifolius.
